header.rec_loc: At ANON's home in Harston, Cambridgeshire.
header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.topics: A friend of ANON's birthday arrangements and birthday present, fire arms licence and rifle shooting practice, discussion of a recent film called â€™71, discussion of the actual historic events of Northern Irish situation in 1971; discussion of how to organise an event for entrepreneurs; giving a birthday present to ANON; discussed which film to watch for the evening; discussion of a book by Flora Tristan.
header.activity: A father, daughter and son-in-law having an evening meal together.
header.conv_type: Discussing, explaining, inquiring, advising, requesting, anecdote telling

speaker.fls: French -- level unspecified; German -- level unspecified
French -- level unspecified; German -- level unspecified

very good very very good there was actually quite an interesting character erm characterisation of a soldier who gets left behind and they've only just got to erm Belfast and they you know they're all a very erm fresh you know aabout the whole thing even their commanding officer is cos they sounded like they just you know straight out of Sandhurst kind of thing and there's this section where you see how there is a sergeant who said they put all their riot gear on to go out into the streets and erm and the the the the lieutenant comes and says no no I want everybody in berets because I want people to see I want them to see that we are here to do a different type of job you know which is the peacekeeping element and I want to reassure people that you know we're not here to kill them erm and the sergeant says are you sure sir? he says yes I'm sure but when the scene plays out a whole bunch of very angry people turn up erm and you know itit's a riot you know a full scale riot on their hands erm and it's chaos just kind of reigns erm the these paramilitary I'm not quite sure who they were but they had like you know they had armoured cars but they went inside the houses and they actually were talking to the well they weren't talking they were saying show us where your fucking guns are you know and I'm not quite sure where they look more milit they look like maybe police military or something I wasn't quite sure they weren't the army erm they sort of wore black kind of big black coats that they had black erm helmets on sort of Kevlars kind of thing were quite dark coloured certcertainly not army anyway
sounds like police actually
the police though the police

right so they were the police and they were quite and then they're doing their bit and then the army well the troop you know the soldiers trying to keep the line they're not main about to maintain it and er one little boy picks up a soldier's rifle runs away with it the soldier who's lost his rifle runs after the little boy and then then the whole big bunch of erm men just basically surround these two soldiers and er one of them just comes up with the pistol and just shoots the this guy straight in the face and then this woman who's actually Catholic stops everyone and says how dare you to all these boys to these men you know how dare you you know what are you doing? are you turning into animals? so this one soldier saved but in the whole big scheme of things he gets left behind and that's where the story starts so he's left in Belfest Belfast only with a minimal briefing of you've got to avoid this place called Delvis Flats or something like that DDevlers Flats or
Divers Flats

so what I've erm been talking to some friends about is this idea of if the business a problem so this is kind of the I suppose the context of this this particular session erm what I did was talk about some of these various people in their they're starting up businesses I was talking to my friends about it and and I kinda said well there are all these people who are individuals trying to start a business by themselves so they've got to upskill and learn and do everything all by themselves to get to some kind of point where they've got enough of a customer base to get the software product up and running right
